mx.com.nacho.utils

Class SocialSecurityNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • mx.com.nacho.utils.SocialSecurityNumber

  • public class SocialSecurityNumber
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to validate and format a Social Security Number (SSN). The validate method is using the Regular Expresion explained in the article "Validating Social Security Numbers through Regular Expressions" by Rion Williams.
    See Also:
    Validating Social Security Numbers through Regular Expressions

      Constructor and Description
      SocialSecurityNumber(int ssn)
      Constructor by numeric SSN.

        Constructor by numeric SSN.
        Parameters:
        ssn - The Social Secutiry Number.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Validates the provided SSN based in the "Over-The-Top Validation" in the article "Validating Social Security Numbers through Regular Expressions" by Rion Williams.
        Returns:
        True if the SSN provided is valid.
        See Also:
        Validating Social Security Numbers through Regular Expressions

      • getRawSSN

        public int getRawSSN()
        Get the numeric representation of the SSN.
        Returns:
        The numeric representation of the SSN.

      • getStringSSN

        public java.lang.String getStringSSN()
        Get the String representation of the SSN. If the SSN has less than 9 digits, it will fill with leading zeros.
        Returns:
        The String representation of the SSN.

      • getFormattedSSN

        public java.lang.String getFormattedSSN()
        Get the formatted String representation of the SSN.
        Format: XXX-XX-XXXX
        Returns:
        The formatted String representation of the SSN.

      • getMaskedSSN

        public java.lang.String getMaskedSSN()
        Get the masked representation of the SSN.
        Format: XXX-XX-1234
        Returns:
        The masked representation of the SSN.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
